revised_title: Susceptibility of Animals to the Human Strain of Trypanosome Causing Disease in Man in Nyasaland
tldr: The study investigates the susceptibility of various animals to the human strain of trypanosome causing disease in Nyasaland. The researchers found that goats, sheep, dogs, rabbits, and rats were susceptible to the disease, with varying degrees of severity and duration. The findings contribute to understanding the transmission and impact of the disease on humans and animals.
